name: NPR
text:
RT @NPRGoatsandSoda: The U.S. will probably have enough doses to vaccinate their population two times over. And Canada will have enough for their population five times over.
  
https://t.co/Mrmhq11lvs

name: NPR
text:
Across Syria, people are facing shortages of subsidized bread — at a time when, for many, it's one of the only foods they can still afford.

Nowadays, people say they're having to wait up to six hours in line for meager rations.
https://t.co/rdU4oImKQG

name: NPR
text:
A Wisconsin court commissioner denied a request to dismiss 2 of the 6 charges facing Kyle Rittenhouse, who is accused of killing 2 people during the Kenosha protests — and ordered the case to go to trial.
https://t.co/NMbpQlLWbV

name: NPR
text: Dr. Francis Collins to his fellow Christians: "When you put on that mask ... You're doing the altruistic, loving thing of saying, 'I'm going to protect people from me.' And that's a Christian action if ever I've heard one." https://t.co/6kmNQLhgXR

name: NPR
text:
RT @maddie_sofia: I've done more than 100 interviews for #NPRShortWave but I think this is the only one I've cried in the middle of. 

Please take the time to listen to what healthcare workers in Nebraska are going through. They don't need hero worship. They need help. 

https://t.co/xr47SB1ZGm

name: NPR
text:
Even in a year like 2020, art can still break through.

For @NPRMusic, these 100 songs were an urgent cacophony of distinct voices — and a silver lining in a collectively awful year.
https://t.co/31EBqn5mY5

name: NPR
text:
Attorney General William Barr said this week that the Justice Department found no evidence of widespread fraud in this year's election. When asked whether he still had confidence in Barr, President Trump said: 

"Ask me that in a number of weeks from now."
https://t.co/hy9NRTAswL

name: NPR
text:
Over the past 20 years, the number of people over 65 who have died as a result of extreme heat has increased more than 50%, a report in the Lancet says. At least 296,000 people died because of heat in 2018.
https://t.co/d1evG9w64P

name: NPR
text:
RT @ElenaMMoore: While the lives of presidential children & grandchildren have historically been kept mostly private, Biden's granddaughters and Harris' stepchildren have formed their own public personas

They’re on Twitter, Instagram and TikTok - and some talk politics 

https://t.co/2ySYobuKcU
